p: In agreement with these proposals, rates of evolution measured in a single infected individual persistently infected with a continuously replicating virus tend to be higher than those observed with the same viruses isolated from different individuals ( Morse, 1994, Domingo et al., 2001, Domingo, 2006). Slowly evolving viral genes may nevertheless undergo episodes of rapid evolution and, vice versa, a rapidly evolving gene may be transiently static. This should be considered in statistical approaches to evolution ( Gaucher et al., 2002).
